isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - ADJUSTMENTS - REAR HOOD GUIDE SUPPORT ADJUSTMENT

svcsubproc.title: Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment In or Out on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 62 for all Items in parentheses.
To adjust the side of the hood in or out at the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to align the side of the hood with the side of the cab, use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2), loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the two hex bolts (Item 3) holding the hood guide support (Item 1) to the hood guide support bracket (Item 4), driver side shown.
Push the hood guide support (Item 1) in or out, as required, until the rear edge of the hood is even with the side of the cab, driver side shown.

With the rear edge of the hood even with the side of the cab, hold the rear hood guide support (Item 1) in place on the hood guide support bracket (Item 4) and tighten the two hex bolts (Item 3), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to adjust the passenger side rear hood guide support in or out.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood

svcsubproc.title: Rear Hood Guide Support Adjustment Up or Down on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 62 for all Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.
To adjust the hood up or down at the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to adjust the inside of the hood with the cowl hood seal, use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the two hex bolts (Item 5) at the front of the mounting bracket (Item 6), driver side shown.

Reach under the fender and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2), run the adjusting hex bolt (Item 7) up or down to raise or lower the hood guide support (Item 1) to make the inside top of the hood contact the cowl hood seal properly, driver side shown.
Once the inside top of the hood contacts the cowl hood seal properly, tighten the two hex bolts (Item 5), driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to adjust the passenger side rear hood guide support up or down.

It may be necessary to adjust the rear hood guide (Item 2, Figure 61) up or down along with the rear hood guide support (Item 1) to make the inside top of the hood contact the cowl hood seal properly.
